question: 武装
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: The most important part of your <kanji>military</kanji> <kanji>attire</kanji> are your <vocabulary>arms</vocabulary> (not the ones attached to your body, your guns and stuff). Arms are what make you a real military person.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
